snippet.title: Ion exchange : theory and application
snippet.description: Ion exchange : theory and application / Nachod, FC Ion Exchange Burlington, MA : Elsevier, 2012. - 424 p.

snippet.title: TECHNICAL COORDINATION
snippet.description: TECHNICAL COORDINATION / A. Ball and W. Zeuner Operational experience 2011 CMS is approaching the end of a very successful year of operation. Proton- proton running ended in the late afternoon of 30th October with a stunning 5.73 fb–1 delivered by LHC, of which CMS recorded 5.22 fb–1. [...] CMSBUL-ARTICLE-2011-054.- 2011 \- Published in : , no. 3/2011, pp. 2

snippet.title: MUON DETECTORS: DT
snippet.description: MUON DETECTORS: DT / C. Fernandez Bedova and M. Dallavalle After successful operation during the 2009 LHC run, a number of fixes and improvements were carried out on the DT system the winter shutdown. The main concern was related with the impact of the extensive water leak that happened in October in YE+1 [...] CMSBUL-ARTICLE-2010-009.- 2010 \- Published in : , no. 1/2010, pp. 9

snippet.title: TECHNICAL COORDINATION
snippet.description: TECHNICAL COORDINATION / A. Ball ; W. Zeuner. Overview From a technical perspective, CMS has been in “beam operation” state since 6th November. The detector is fully closed with all components operational and the magnetic field is normally at the nominal 3.8T [...] CMSBUL-ARTICLE-2009-199.- \- Published in : , no. 3/2009, pp. 2

snippet.title: MUON DETECTOR
snippet.description: MUON DETECTOR / F. Gasparini ; G. Iaselli ; R. Breedon ; T. Rodrigo Anoro DT As announced in the previous Bulletin MU DT completed the installation of the vertical chambers of barrel wheels 0, +1 and +2. 242 DT and RPC stations are now installed in the negative barrel wheels [...] CMSBUL-ARTICLE-2009-139.- \- Published in : , no. 3/2007, pp. 12

snippet.title: MUON DETECTOR BARREL DRIFT TUBES (DT)
snippet.description: MUON DETECTOR BARREL DRIFT TUBES (DT) / Fabrizio Gasparini ; Guiseppe Iaselli ; Teresa Rodrigo Anoro ; Richard Breedon The DT system is made of 250 chambers, installed in the five wheels of the CMS Iron Yoke. Each wheel is subdivided in 10 sectors of four chambers each [...] CMSBUL-ARTICLE-2009-086.- \- Published in : , no. 2/2008, pp. 11

snippet.title: ALICE at full power ALICE tourne à plein régime
snippet.description:
ALICE at full power ALICE tourne à plein régime <b>The ALICE dipole magnet recently passed its commissioning tests, which was also an important step forward for the collaboration [BUL-NA-2005-006]; [04/2005].- Published in CERN Bulletin 04/2005

snippet.title: LHCb collaboration celebrates magnet's success La collaboration LHCb célèbre le succès de son aimant
snippet.description:
LHCb collaboration celebrates magnet's success La collaboration LHCb célèbre le succès de son aimant <b>The LHCb magnet reached full current and achieved the designed magnetic field on 9 November, a major milestone for the collaboration [BUL-NA-2004-246]; [50/2004].- Published in CERN Bulletin 50/2004

snippet.title: Removal of radon by aeration : testing of various aeration techniques for small water works. For European Commission under Contract No FI4PCT960054 TENAWA project
snippet.description: Removal of radon by aeration : testing of various aeration techniques for small water works. For European Commission under Contract No FI4PCT960054 TENAWA project / Salonen, L ; Hagberg, N ; Mehtonen, J ; Mjoenes, L ; Raff, O ; Turunen, H Capability of various aeration techniques to remove radon from water in small waterworks was studied as a part of project (Treatment Techniques for Removing Natural Radionuclides from Drinking Water), which was carried out during 1997-1999 on a cost-shared basis (contract No [...] STUK-A-193. \- 2002\. - 46 p.
